explanation: The program prompts for a name and age using std::cout, reads each value with std::cin, then echoes a formatted summary. The first response line ends with a newline character (\n) while the final message uses std::endl to echo the lesson's discussion about flushing the stream.
keyPoints: Chain std::cout insertions to build sentences
std::cin >> variable reads the next token from input
Use std::endl sparingly when you need an immediate flush
